item.title: Bayes Capstone: (Pseudo) Bayesian Model Averaging
item.description: Introduction to Common Model Selections Critera Model specification is an element of statistics whose importance is often glossed over. In most cases, there are multiple appropriate models for a set of data. The end choice of model can hugely impact the results, and classical methods offer limited guidance on the best process for accounting for the uncertainty this creates. Unstructured searches and checks for the best model specification can lead to incorrect inferences, fragile reported findings, and publication bias (Montgomery and Nyhan 2010).
